-   **Rarity note:** Found in Southeastern United States in open woodlands and fields with tall grasses. 

## Natural history notes

Long-headed Toothpick Grasshoppers (Achurum carinatum) coloration is a pale brown to gray, with occasional green legs. They are known for their slanted faces with sword-like antennae. They are flightless due to their small, elongated wings. They are found year round in Florida. Their primary food sources are grasses.
